name: outsail
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to sail a boat faster or better than someone else: The larger vessels easily outsailed them and soon disappeared from view. Team New Zealand had hull and mast failures in two of the five races and were out-sailed in the others.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Italians outsailed the Americans.These vessels were capable of outsailing other ships in their class and also capable of outrunning anything larger.
